item.title: Using Spack package manager for supercomputers to install software locally
item.description: I often find myself building software in different machines, with different configurations, architectures and compilers. Sometimes I just need to install some package in a server with not enough permissions to do so via the regular package manager. Spack to the rescue! Let’s see an example where one wants to use tmux in a machine where it is not installed, nor one has permissions to do so. Given that python is present in the system, and a compiler, one can try to compile tmux, to quickly find it will need several dependencies like libevent.
